reaction temperature at 25 C. The reaction mixture was continuously stirred magnetically and irradiated under a 300 W Xe lamp ( 420 nm) to initiate a photocatalytic reaction.After 4 h of reaction, the products were analyzed through an Agilent 7890B GC equipped with a thermal conductivity detector (TCD) and a flame ionization detector (FID).The isotope labeling experiment was performed by using 13 CO 2 to replace the 12 CO 2 atmosphere, and the product was detected by GC-MS method. and some other similar systems (Table S3).Simultaneously, BMOIS-1 also has a high selectivity for CO generation (94.1), and the BMOIS-1 catalyst delivers a high apparent quantum efficiency (AQE) of 2.11 under 420 nm monochromatic light irradiation.The outstanding CO 2 -to-CO conversion performance of the BMOIS-1 catalyst can be attributed to the hierarchical hollow structure, the high-efficiency carrier separation, and the strong redox ability of electrons and holes brought by the S-scheme heterojunction

were performed on the CHI660D electrochemical workstation (Shanghai Chenhua Co., Ltd.) with a conventional three-electrode mode. The photocatalytic CO 2 reduction activity of the obtained samples was evaluated in a 100 mL Pyrex reactor.The 30 mg sample was dispersed in 50 mL ultrapure water.After the reactor was degassed for 30 min, high-purity CO 2 gas (99.999) was pumped into the system to reach 1 atmosphere pressure.Simultaneously, circulating water was used to maintain the reaction temperature at 25 C.

Please find the category of Light_source and Lamp from the provided context which describe an solar chemical experiment.
The generation condition of the extraction is given: If Light_source is Solar or Solar Simulator, Lamp is always Solar Simulator.

reaction temperature at 25 C. The reaction mixture was continuously stirred magnetically and irradiated under a 300 W Xe lamp ( 420 nm) to initiate a photocatalytic reaction.After 4 h of reaction, the products were analyzed through an Agilent 7890B GC equipped with a thermal conductivity detector (TCD) and a flame ionization detector (FID).The isotope labeling experiment was performed by using 13 CO 2 to replace the 12 CO 2 atmosphere, and the product was detected by GC-MS method. GC-MS method. To evaluate the stability, five consecutive catalytic reactions were carried out, and the catalytic system was purged with CO 2 for 30 min without adding more catalyst before the next photocatalytic reaction started.In addition, the apparent quantum efficiency (AQE) of the BMO IS-1 sample was evaluated under the same photocatalytic reaction conditions.The monochromatic light source was designated as radiation source, where the light intensity was 21 mWcm 2 and the light area was 28.274 cm 2

of SOVs could be in favor of the light-harvesting.More importantly, after combining with IS, BMIS and BMOIS composite catalysts exhibit stronger light absorption extending to most of the visible-light region.And as the IS content increases, the optical absorption window of the BMOIS composite catalyst is enlarged.It can be concluded that the construction of SOVs and heterostructure both help to ameliorate the visible-light harvesting of the samples, which will effectively increase the potential yields of

and some other similar systems (Table S3).Simultaneously, BMOIS-1 also has a high selectivity for CO generation (94.1), and the BMOIS-1 catalyst delivers a high apparent quantum efficiency (AQE) of 2.11 under 420 nm monochromatic light irradiation.The outstanding CO 2 -to-CO conversion performance of the BMOIS-1 catalyst can be attributed to the hierarchical hollow structure, the high-efficiency carrier separation, and the strong redox ability of electrons and holes brought by the S-scheme heterojunction

were performed on the CHI660D electrochemical workstation (Shanghai Chenhua Co., Ltd.) with a conventional three-electrode mode. The photocatalytic CO 2 reduction activity of the obtained samples was evaluated in a 100 mL Pyrex reactor.The 30 mg sample was dispersed in 50 mL ultrapure water.After the reactor was degassed for 30 min, high-purity CO 2 gas (99.999) was pumped into the system to reach 1 atmosphere pressure.Simultaneously, circulating water was used to maintain the reaction temperature at 25 C.

by the S-scheme heterojunction 59,60.As presented in Fig. 6b, the variation tendency of COH 2 generation qualitatively follows the characteristic absorption spectrum of the BMOIS-1 material, powerfully supporting that the CO 2 photoreduction is driven by the inter-band transition electrons of the BMOIS-1 catalyst.
